name: Frank Lindseth
content: Frank Lindseth - NTNU Frank Lindseth Download press photo Download press photo Foto: Close Frank Lindseth Professor Department of Computer Science Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering frankl@ntnu.no +4792809372 IT-bygget, 414, Gløshaugen, Sem Sælands vei 9 Google Scholar About Frank Lindseth is a Professor at the Department of Computer Science (IDI), NTNU Trondheim. He is part of the Visual Computing group within the Computing unit at IDI and a core member of the Norwegian Open AI-Lab (NAIL). Lindseth's key research interests are within Visual Computing, Computer Vision, Visual Intelligence, AI, Digital Twins and XR - with important application areas related to autonomous driving (AD) / mobility and medical image computing (MIC). Lindseht is leading the NAP-lab (NTNU Autonomous Perception lab) (outdated web-site) togehter with Gabriel Kiss, and is a core member of the Advanced Computation in Healthcare and the XR-NET initiatives (IDI). He is also a core member of the strategic research area Digital Twins and the PERSEUS doctoral programme (IE faculty). Furthermore, he is leading the Mobility part of Green2050 – Centre for Green Shift in the Built Environment, as well as the Digital Technology part of MoST - MobilityLab Stor-Trondheim (IV faculty). Lindseth is also a core member of the following Gemini centers (collaboration between NTNU and SINTEF); Digitalisering og automatisering av fremtidens veitransport, Medical Imaging Research and AI (MIRA) and Extended Realities (XR).
